subject: Relationships
title: Social Media Stalking After a Breakup
description: One-minute skill: Social Media Stalking After a Breakup.

hook.text: You check their Instagram at 2 AM. They posted a photo smiling. You feel sick. You can't stop looking.

buildup.text: 88% of people admit to monitoring their ex's social media after a breakup. It's the modern form of surveillance.

discovery.text: Each check triggers a micro-dose of dopamine â€” followed by cortisol. It's a slot machine of hope and pain.

twist.text: Unfollowing or blocking feels dramatic. But research shows people who block their ex recover significantly faster.

climax.text: Social media turns every breakup into an open wound you can reopen with one tap, anytime, anywhere.

punchline.text: Blocking your ex isn't petty. It's a prescription for faster healing.
